author: PaulK
title: Legal Entities Bonds' Tokenization
description: Currently, legal entities have no many accessible, transparent, and intuitive instruments to attract investments for expansion of activities

assessments.note: The problem statement is reasonable and the proposal has the potential for a dapp, however there is no clarity on how the blockchain will be used and there is no mention of a dapp in the description, this makes the description subjective and difficult to evaluate. We need a clear definition of what activities will need / can be carried out with the help of blockchain to understand the impact of the proposal on the challenge.

This proposal needs more clarification for voters assessments. Explanation on the benefits need to be made on more clearer terms. What type of activities are we speaking of? what needs changing from the current methid? decentralization not necesarily means transparency, for some blockchain technology is not a thing besides the little they know of Cryptocurrencies and Bitcoin. Although I can see the potential benefits in almost every field out there creating the tools to make blockcahin technology a transparent term in the legacy systems and institution remains decades in the making.

IF, the proposer would be able to restructure the corporate bond market, that would definitely bring attention, devs and money ton the Cardano Plaftform - but with the information presented here, not at all likely.

There's not enough information provided that would help us determine how proposal aligns with the goals of the community. It would be great if there was a section that would clearly showcase how this proposal benefits ecosytem at large. Worth exploring - concept - but it is just not there yet. Needs more depth in research.

There is a minimal rationale structure, but there are not enough details to fully understand the plan. The proposer describes experience in blockchain technology implementation and software development, but there are no details, I think it is important that the proposer provides links to Github and Linkedin so that the community can evaluate his skills.

In the basis of details on experiences the proposer has bth technical knowledge in blockchain and programming languages, not sure about the legal system and the shortcommings therein. More collaboration and clearer description of the solution may provide further clarity to voters.
No indication that the proposer has worked in the Bond market. No indication of a team. No indication of a plan. Just a number which perhaps mistakenly requests $400,000.

Not enough data provided by the proposers to effectively judge its merit. No budget breakdown and lack of establishing validity in experience are two major pain points seen here. This stems from lack of actual sensible budget.

There is not enough information to check technical feasibility and clarify aspects of regulation. What are the legal obstacles to issuing bonds in blockchains? Is there regulatory clarity? These are important aspects and risks that need to be addressed. The proposal has the potential to address the challenge, but in order for us to have a sense of impact and relevance in the challenge, it is important that a more detailed plan is described. I recommend that the proposer update the proposal, inserting the information that I commented on and that he elaborates the new proposal based on the documentation of the Catalyst guidelines

More consideration on a road map or some forms of metrics are needed to be communicated for the feasibility of this project outcome. The benefits outside the bonds could be expanded and more into the overarching benefits to the industry perhaps should be explored for a more effective method of using the blockchain as a tool in the trade.
Lacks all sorts of information that would even begin to suggest that this herculean task of restructuring the corporate bond market was feasible.

Since this reads more like a concept - there is lack of actual roadmap and milestones. Nor there is any mention how authors think about success metrics, KPIs, challenges, risks. All of these would have been really useful to understand.

solution: Platform for legal entities to tokenize own bonds after official financial reports and audits with further listing in the internal exchange.
experience: Have experience in blockchain technology implementation and software development, as a BA
